Row.Text: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Happiness[ENDCOLOR] is one of the new gameplay elements added by Cities in Development. It is the measurement of a city's appeal and is used to offset Unhappiness. When a city has more Happiness than Unhappiness, that Happiness contributes directly toward Production.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Unhappiness[ENDCOLOR] is the opposite to Happiness. When a city has more Unhappiness than Happiness, it may enter a period of Resistance after too long. Unhappiness is primarily increased by the city's Population.

A city's [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Happiness[ENDCOLOR] is increased through the construction of buildings such as the Colosseum. It is also increased by your Global Happiness, which is applied locally based upon the number of cities in your empire.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Resistance[ENDCOLOR] is a state in which the city cannot produce any yields. A period of Resistance will occur if a city is more Unhappy than it is Happy for too long. This is the same state incurred after conquering a city.
